resources:
Rekado
Payloads Instructions Logs About Donate Settings
Information Developer Application written in Kotlin and C++. It is used to inject payloads on the Nintendo Switch GitHub Twitter
Cable First you need to find a cable to connect your device to the Nintendo Switch. For proper work, this should be a cable that is designed for data transmission, not just for charging.\n\nIt is advisable to use an A-to-C cable and an USB OTG adapter. Payload In the \u0022Payloads\u0022 category, click the \u0022+\u0022 button to select preloaded payload from your device\'s storage. Or simply transfer your payload to the Rekado folder in the device\'s memory.\n\nOr you can use the bundled payloads (SX Loader/ReiNX) RCM Enter your Nintendo Switch into RCM mode in any convenient way. \n\nYour Nintendo Switch will power on by itself when plugged in, be sure to hold VOLUME +. Final Connect the device to the Nintendo Switch and allow permission for the USB access if necessary. Wait unit payloads chooser dialog will be opened and select which one you want to load.
List of actions
Donate You can support the development of the application in several ways. Bitcoin Bitcoin Cash Ethereum Litecoin %1$s address copied!
Auto injector Enable \u0022Auto injector\u0022 Disable \u0022Auto injector\u0022 Payload Payloads Clear Remove all added payloads except bundled (SX Loader/ReiNX) Appearance Night mode Accent color Color used to tint UI elements Settings changed Settings have been changed. Please, restart for the change to take effect. \n\nRestart the app now? Restart Cancel Choose color
Storage permission Rekado need this permission to get payload files from your device\'s storage. RequestRE Could not access device\'s storage. Try to get permission again.
Choose payload Clear Are you sure you want to delete payloads? OK Cancel Choose payload
Are you sure this is correct payload file?
